page.title: 03Country Houses.
page.content: As you approach the village of Framfield from Uckfield you may just catch a glimpse of Framfield Place.It stands in 3 acres of ground and was built in 1765.An extension was added in 1890 when the last large family (the Baxendales) was in residence.This was designed by Sir Edward Luchens and Sir Norman Shaw. Today the mansion has been divided into six units.Each one of these units is rented out separately.One of the lady residents we interviewed told us she used part of the land to grow herbs and plants,which she then sold from a cart at local fetes etc.She was also able to tell us that until recently Framfield Place Pond had belonged to the villagers of Framfield.
